intro: Medusantha eriophylla var. eriophylla, commonly known as the white-flowered medusantha, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its flowers, which range from white to pale pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
